isaInvestigation.title: Investigation
isaInvestigation.description: Created using the MetaboLights Online Editor (MOE)

studies.title: Cysteamine-bicalutamide combination therapy corrects proximal tubule phenotype in cystinosis
studies.description: Nephropathic cystinosis is a severe monogenic kidney disorder caused by mutations in CTNS, encoding the lysosomal transporter cystinosin, resulting in lysosomal cystine accumulation. The sole treatment, cysteamine, slows down the disease progression, but does not correct the established renal proximal tubulopathy. Here, we developed a new therapeutic strategy by applying omics to expand our knowledge on the complexity of the disease and prioritize drug targets in cystinosis. We identified alpha-ketoglutarate as a potential metabolite to bridge cystinosin loss to autophagy, apoptosis and kidney proximal tubule impairment in cystinosis. This insight combined with a drug screen revealed a bicalutamide-cysteamine combination treatment as a novel dual-target pharmacological approach for the phenotypical correction of cystinotic kidney proximal tubule cells, patient-derived kidney tubuloids and cystinotic zebrafish.

publications.title: Cysteamine-bicalutamide combination therapy corrects proximal tubule phenotype in cystinosis.
publications.authorList: Jamalpoor A, van Gelder CA, Yousef Yengej FA, Zaal EA, Berlingerio SP, Veys KR, Pou Casellas C, Voskuil K, Essa K, Ammerlaan CM, Rega LR, van der Welle RE, Lilien MR, Rookmaaker MB, Clevers H, Klumperman J, Levtchenko E, Berkers CR, Verhaar MC, Altelaar M, Masereeuw R, Janssen MJ.

protocols.name: Sample collection
protocols.description:
The ciPTEC were cultured as described previously[1]. The culture medium was Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium DMEM/F-12 (GIBCO) supplemented with fetal calf serum 10% (v/v), insulin 5 µg/ml, transferrin 5 µg/ml, selenium 5 µg/ml, hydrocortisone 35 ng/ml, epidermal growth factor 10 ng/ml and tri-iodothyronine 40 pg/ml. In short, cells were seeded at a density of 55,000 cells/cm^2 and grown at 33 °C for 24 h to enable them to proliferate and subsequently cultured at 37 °C for 7 d to mature into fully differentiated epithelial cells. As a reference we also included a non-isogenic patient derived CTNS−/− ciPTEC line, which will be referred to as CTNSPatient.


Ref:

[1] Wilmer MJ, Saleem MA, Masereeuw R, Ni L, van der Velden TJ, Russel FG, Mathieson PW, Monnens LA, van den Heuvel LP, Levtchenko EN. Novel conditionally immortalized human proximal tubule cell line expressing functional influx and efflux transporters. Cell Tissue Res. 2010 Feb;339(2):449-57. doi:10.1007/s00441-009-0882-y. PMID:19902259.

protocols.name: Extraction
protocols.description: CiPTEC cells were washed with ice cold PBS and metabolites were extracted in 1 ml lysis buffer containing methanol/acetonitrile/dH2O (2:2:1). Samples were centrifuged at 16.000 x g for 15 min at 4 °C and supernatants were collected for LC-MS analysis.

protocols.name: Chromatography
protocols.description: LC analysis was performed on a Dionex Ultimate 3000 autosampler and pump (Thermo Scientific). Metabolites were separated using a Sequant ZIC-pHILIC column (2.1 x 150 mm, 5 μm, guard column 2.1 x 20 mm, 5 μm; Merck) with elution buffers acetonitrile (A) and eluent B (20 mM (NH4)2CO3, 0.1% NH4OH in ULC/MS grade water (Biosolve)). Gradient ran from 20% eluent B to 60% eluent B in 20 min, followed by a wash step at 80% and equilibration at 20%, with a flow rate of 150 μl/min.

protocols.name: Mass spectrometry
protocols.description: MS analysis was performed on an Exactive mass spectrometer (Thermo Scientific). The MS operated in polarity-switching mode with spray voltages of 4.5 kV and -3.5 kV.

protocols.name: Data transformation
protocols.description: Analysis was performed using LCquan software (Thermo Scientific). Peak areas were normalized based on total peak intensities.

protocols.name: Metabolite identification
protocols.description:
Metabolites were identified and quantified on the basis of exact mass within 5 ppm and further validated by concordance with retention times of standards. Data were analyzed using MetaboAnalyst[1].


Ref:

[1] Chong J, Yamamoto M, Xia J. MetaboAnalystR 2.0: From Raw Spectra to Biological Insights. Metabolites. 2019 Mar 22;9(3):57. doi:10.3390/metabo9030057. PMID:30909447.
